resources.string:
- Immediately drop to the ground.

- Take cover under a sturdy table or desk.

- Hold on until the shaking stops.
Stay inside, away from windows.

- If outdoors, stay in the open away from buildings.

- If driving, pull over and stay inside.

- After shaking stops, check yourself and others.

- Be prepared for more shaking.

- Follow official instructions.

- Assist neighbors if possible.

- National Disaster Response Force (NDRF): 011–26701728, 011–26701729

- State Emergency Operation Cent ers (SEOCs): Each state in India has its own emergency helpline numbers.

Here are a few examples:

Delhi: 1077 (Disaster Management)

Maharashtra: 022–22027990, 022–22025274

Gujarat: 1070 (Disaster Management)

Uttar Pradesh: 1070 (Disaster Management)

Andhra Pradesh: 0863–2234334

Kerala: 0471–2331639, 0471–2333198

Tamil Nadu: 1070 (Disaster Management)

West Bengal: 1070 (Disaster Management)

Assam: 1070 (Disaster Management)

Rajasthan: 0141–2225624


Additionally:

Police: 100

Emergency Medical Service: 108

" "- Get out of the building immediately.

 - Call the fire department.

 - Do not attempt to extinguish a large fire yourself.

 - If trapped, stay low to the ground to avoid smoke inhalation.

 - Close doors behind you to slow the spread of fire.

" "- Fire Emergency: 101

 - National Emergency Number: 112

 - Delhi
 Delhi Fire Service Control Room: +91-11-23411234

 - Mumbai
 Mumbai Fire Brigade Control Room: +91-22-23085991 / +91-22-23076111

 - Bengaluru
 Bengaluru Fire Service Control Room: +91-80-22971500

 - Chennai
 Chennai Fire & Rescue Services: +91-44-28594471 / +91-44-28551212

 - Kolkata
 Kolkata Fire Brigade Control Room: +91-33-22521165

 - Hyderabad
 Hyderabad Fire Service Control Room: +91-40-23321487

" "- Evacuate if instructed to do so.

 - Avoid walking or driving through floodwaters.

 - Unplug electrical appliances.

 - Be aware of the dangers of mold after floodwaters recede.

 - Listen to the radio for updates.

" "- National Disaster Response Force (NDRF): 011–26701728, 011–26701729

 Delhi
 - Delhi Flood Control Room: +91-11-23811388 / +91-11-23811489

 Mumbai
 - Mumbai Disaster Management Control Room: +91-22-22694725 / +91-22-22694727

 Bengaluru
 - BBMP (Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike) Flood Helpline: +91-80-22660000 / +91-80-22660001

 Chennai
 - Chennai Flood Control Room: +91-44-25384530 / +91-44-25384540

 Kolkata
 - Kolkata Municipal Corporation Flood Helpline: +91-33-22861212 / +91-33-22861313

 Hyderabad
 - GHMC (Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation) Flood Helpline: +91-40-21111111

 Ahmedabad
 - Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation Flood Helpline: +91-79-25391811 / +91-79-27560778

 Pune
 - Pune Municipal Corporation Flood Helpline: +91-20-25501125 / +91-20-25501120

 Jaipur
 - Jaipur Municipal Corporation Flood Helpline: +91-141-2560327

 Lucknow
 - Lucknow Municipal Corporation Flood Helpline: +91-522-2612144

 Thiruvananthapuram
 - Thiruvananthapuram Flood Control Room: +91-471-2333101 / +91-471-2730045

" "- Seek shelter indoors.

 - Avoid using electronic devices.

 - Stay away from windows and doors.

 - If outdoors, find a low-lying area away from trees and open spaces.

 - Listen to the radio for weather updates.

" "- National Disaster Response Force (NDRF): 011–26701728, 011–26701729

 - Delhi

 Delhi Thunderstorm Control Room: +91-11-23811388 / +91-11-23811489
 - Mumbai

" "- Secure loose outdoor objects.

 - Stay indoors during the storm.

 - Avoid driving if possible.

 - Be prepared for power outages.

 - Listen to the radio for warnings.

" "- National Disaster Response Force (NDRF): 011–26701728, 011–26701729

 - Delhi
 Delhi Windstorm Control Room: +91-11-23811388 / +91-11-23811489

 - Mumbai
 Mumbai Disaster Management Control Room: +91-22-22694725 / +91-22-22694727

 - Bengaluru
 BBMP (Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike) Control Room: +91-80-22660000 / +91-80-22660001

" "- Stay Indoors: Keep away from windows and doors.

 - Turn Off Power: Disconnect electrical appliances to prevent surges.

 - Stay Calm: Listen to official instructions and updates.

 - Emergency Communication: Keep emergency contacts handy and use phones only for important calls.

 - Evacuate if Needed: Move to higher ground or a designated shelter if instructed.

" "- Evacuate Immediately: Move to higher ground if you feel an earthquake or receive a warning.

 - Avoid the Coast: Stay away from beaches and low-lying areas.

 - Listen to Authorities: Follow official instructions on radio or mobile alerts.

 - Stay Indoors: If unable to evacuate, move to the highest floor of a sturdy building.

" "- Stay Calm: Take deep breaths to stay focused.

 - Check for Injuries: Assess yourself and passengers for injuries.

 - Move to Safety: If possible, move the vehicle to the side of the road to avoid further collisions.

 - Turn on Hazard Lights: Alert other drivers to the accident.

 - Call Emergency Services: Dial 112 for police, ambulance, and fire services.
